timeline.message:
Per isl bfd properties

Add ability to define BFD interval and multiplier for each ISL. New API
v2 endpoint was created for this feature. Existing API v1 endpoint was
adopted to use default BFD properties on enable request.

Per isl bfd properties

Add ability to define BFD interval and multiplier for each ISL. New API
v2 endpoint was created for this feature. Existing API v1 endpoint was
adopted to use default BFD properties on enable request.

timeline.bodyText: As for me readBfdProperties and writeBfdProperties is better methods naming.
timeline.author: rozdy

replies.bodyText:
The proposed named schema provide one handy "feature" - it provides natural method grouping - into alphabetically ordered lists you will always have methods working with the same object placed together. Also, the targeted object is more important than the action being applied to it. That why bfdPropertiesRead is handier than readBfdProperties at least for me.
Renaming...
replies.author: surabujin

timeline.author: rozdy
rozdy
rozdy

replies.bodyText: no. It reads effective value stored into bfd_session collection, not "goal" value stored into isl collections.
replies.author: surabujin

timeline.author: rozdy
rozdy

timeline.bodyText: I guess you can rename leftToRight and rightToLeft to simple left and right.
timeline.author: rozdy
rozdy
rozdy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -106,13 +108,15 @@
      */
     CompletableFuture<List<LinkDto>> deleteLink(LinkParametersDto linkParameters, boolean force);
 
-    /**
-     * Update "Enable BFD" flag.
-     *
-     * @param link link parameters.
-     * @return updated link.
-     */
-    CompletableFuture<List<LinkDto>> updateLinkEnableBfd(LinkEnableBfdDto link);
+    CompletableFuture<List<LinkDto>> bfdPropertiesWrite(

timeline.bodyText: Didn't get it. Why we need to discard this call?
timeline.author: rozdy

replies.bodyText:
... this is the ugly design of nbworker.
Method islBfdPropertiesChanged is part of ILinkOperationsServiceCarrier, this interface are implemented by LinkOperationsBolt and SwitchOperationsBolt. LinkOperationsBolt can and must provide a correct implementation of this method, while SwitchOperationsBolt can't do it. I have added this warning to have visibility of the issue, when something will goest wrong.
replies.author: surabujin

timeline.bodyText: Do we still need this method?
timeline.author: rozdy

replies.bodyText: I would like to keep it and follow TODO placed there i.e. "ensure the switch is BFD capable".
replies.author: surabujin

timeline.bodyText: Please, double-check that property is worked as expected on the current master.
timeline.author: nikitamarchenko

replies.bodyText: Is there any specific scenario that causes this comment to appear here? I will review BFD "reportiong" tools one more time.
replies.author: surabujin

replies.bodyText: Because there are no(since this commit) corresponding constants that keep default values for these fields and because this is the test object.
replies.author: surabujin

timeline.author: nikitamarchenko

replies.bodyText: I am open to propositions. .../src switch/src port/dst switch/dst_port/... is worse as for me.
replies.author: surabujin

timeline.bodyText: as for me, it is a little bit unusual that the ed ending is missing (ed -> disabled). we almost everywhere(except roundTrip) use the ed ending (i.e. failed, activated, discovered)
timeline.author: andriidovhan

adopted to use default BFD properties on enable request.

timeline.bodyText:
I wouldn't use Duration here, it force to create new db converter(converters in our case not the most reliable thing ever),
mappers, etc. While the actual usage of it as duration is made in single place only
timeline.author: timofei-durakov

replies.bodyText:
This is the easiest and simple way to store time duration in an unambiguous way.
Regarding issues with converters - first point - we are going to move out neo4j soon enough, the second we do not have a clear vision where the issue and is there any relation to the number of converters. So I don't see the reason to not use proper/handy data types in our model.
Regarding mappers - all other codebase uses Duration for this field, so if we use a different type here we must use mappers too.
replies.author: surabujin

timeline.bodyText: should we add new fields into toString() method? or just remove toString() to generate it by @Data?
timeline.author: niksv

replies.bodyText:
Can't say for sure.
Looks like .toString() include a brief and only most important view of Isl object. Added fields do not part of the most important fields of Isl object, from my point of view. I would like not to include them in the .toString() view now.
replies.author: surabujin
